  • Constructor Details

    • MusicPlayer

      public MusicPlayer()

  • Method Details

    • startMusic

      public void startMusic()
      Starts playing the background music. This method loads the music file "frogger.mp3" and starts playing it using JavaFX's MediaPlayer class. The music is played indefinitely in a loop. If the music file fails to load or an exception occurs during the process, an error message is printed and the exception is printed to the standard error stream. Example usage: MusicPlayer musicPlayer = new MusicPlayer(); musicPlayer.startMusic();

    • stopMusic

      public void stopMusic()
      Stops the currently playing music. If a MediaPlayer object is currently playing music, this method stops it. Example usage: MusicPlayer musicPlayer = new MusicPlayer(); musicPlayer.stopMusic();

    • pauseMusic

      public void pauseMusic()
      Pauses the currently playing music. If a MediaPlayer object is currently playing music, this method pauses it.

    • resumeMusic

      public void resumeMusic()
      Resumes the currently paused music. If a MediaPlayer object is currently playing music and it is in a paused state, this method resumes the music by calling the play() method on the MediaPlayer object. Example usage: MusicPlayer musicPlayer = new MusicPlayer(); musicPlayer.resumeMusic();

    • muteMusic

      public void muteMusic()
      Mutes the currently playing music. This method checks if a MediaPlayer object is currently playing music. If it is, this method sets the mute property of the MediaPlayer object to true, which mutes the music. Example usage: MusicPlayer musicPlayer = new MusicPlayer(); musicPlayer.muteMusic();

    • unmuteMusic

      public void unmuteMusic()
      Unmutes the currently playing music. This method checks if a MediaPlayer object is currently playing music. If it is, this method sets the mute property of the MediaPlayer object to false, which unmutes the music. Example usage: MusicPlayer musicPlayer = new MusicPlayer(); musicPlayer.unmuteMusic();

    • initializeDeathSound

      public void initializeDeathSound()
      Initializes the death sound. This method loads the death sound file "death.mp3" using the getResource() method of the Class class. The death sound file is located in the resources folder within the classpath. Example usage: MusicPlayer musicPlayer = new MusicPlayer(); musicPlayer.initializeDeathSound();

    • playDeathSound

      public void playDeathSound()
      Plays the death sound if it is initialized. This method checks if the death sound player is not null. If it is not null, it stops the current playback and starts playing the death sound. This method does not return any value. Example usage: musicPlayer.playDeathSound();
